snippet: A panel convened by the Food and Drug Administration concluded that naproxen, the active ingredient in Aleve, did not pose a lower risk of cardiovascular problems than ibuprofen and similar pain drugs.
abstract: Panel convened by Food and Drug Administration concludes that naproxen, active ingredient in Aleve, does not pose lower risk of cardiovascular problems than ibuprofen and similar pain drugs; votes in favor of not changing warning labels.
lead_paragraph: A panel convened by the Food and Drug Administration concluded that naproxen, the active ingredient in Aleve, did not pose a lower risk of cardiovascular problems than ibuprofen and similar pain drugs.
